rationale: Students of diploma Information and Communication Technology Engineering need to have a thorough understanding of fundamental concepts of Communication Engineering. Diploma students undertaking this course are expected to apply the fundamentals of basic electronic communication system to analyze the different communication (Modulation and Demodulation) methods with its techniques, various antenna for specific application this basic course develop skills required to learn communication to meet the expectations of the industry.

courseOutcomes.description: Understand sampling theory and waveforms coding techniques and distinguish various signals
Identify line coding and multiplexing techniques for various applications
Use relevant type of antenna for various applications

practicalExercises.description: Identify and observe different analog and digital signals in time domain and frequency domain using simulator or VLab
Measure amplitude of different sinusoidal frequency signals in frequency domain using Spectrum Analyzer
Measure modulation index of an AM envelope
Determine Modulation Index of Frequency Modulated wave
Locate various sections of AM radio receiver trainer kit and draw the waveforms at input and output side of each section
Locate various sections of FM radio receiver trainer kit and draw the waveforms at input and output side of each section
Check the demodulated AM signal waveform using Envelope detector and draw its input output waveform
Check the demodulated FM signal waveform using Detector and draw its input output waveform
Demonstration of fault finding of AM or FM radio receivers
Obtain the response of AGC circuit of the radio receiver
Based on the sampling frequency, reconstruct the signal
Check the performance PCM system for various sinusoidal signals
Check the performance of PAM system
Check the performance of PWM system
Check the performance of PPM system
Simulate AM, FM and SSB signal using Simulation software
Plot the radiation pattern of an Omni-directional antenna (Polar plot on log/linear scales & Cartesian plot on log/linear scales)
Check radiation pattern of folded dipole antenna
Check the radiation pattern of parabolic reflector antenna

performanceIndicators.indicator: Operate the equipment setup or circuit

hardware: Trainer Board for different Communication Mod-Demod Techniques

affectiveDomainOutcomes: Work as a leader/a team member
Follow safety practices while using electrical appliances
Practice environment friendly methods and processes (Environment related)

unitOutcomes.description: Describe communication system
Define modulation and its need
Show mathematical expression for Double Sideband Full Carrier (DSBFC) Amplitude Modulation (AM) signal
Sketch the frequency spectrum of the DSBFC and SSBSC Amplitude Modulated wave
Show the mathematical relation between carrier power, modulated signal power and modulation index
Define Frequency modulation with relevant sketches
Define Phase modulation with relevant sketches

topics.title: Block diagram of Analog and Digital communication system
Modulation: Definition & its classification based on analog & pulse signal as carrier
Mathematical Expression
Draw waveform, frequency spectrum for DSBFC and SSBSC Amplitude Modulated wave
Modulation Index, carrier power, modulated signal power and modulation index and Power saving in SSB
Mathematical representation of FM wave Modulation index and Bandwidth of FM and Show waveforms, Frequency spectrum
Definition of phase modulation
Compare AM and FM

unitOutcomes.description: Define the characteristics of radio receiver
Describe the functions of each block of super heterodyne receiver
Describe AM detection method
Explain functions of various blocks of FM receiver
Explain working of FM demodulations

topics.title: Characteristic of radio receiver, Sensitivity, Selectivity, Fidelity, Image frequency rejection
Block diagram and working of super heterodyne receiver, IF selection, Image frequency
Envelope detector using diode
Block diagram of basic FM receiver
Principal of FM demodulators

unitOutcomes.description: Represent Sinusoidal, Rectangular, Saw-tooth, Impulse and Pulse waveform
State the need of sampling theorem
Describe the Nyquist criteria
Effect of Sampling rate
Explain sampling techniques
Define the following: quantization step-size, resolution, uniform and non-uniform-quantizer, Quantization noise, Companding
Explain PAM, PWM and PPM signals with definition and waveform

topics.title: Signals and its representation: analog and digital Signal, Pulse, Impulse, Saw-tooth, sinusoidal and rectangular (In Time & frequency domain)
Statement of sampling theorem
Nyquist rate and interval
Aliasing error, under sampling, over sampling and critical sampling
Ideal, Natural and flat top sampling
Concept of Quantization
Classification of quantization
Pulse Modulation techniques, definition and waveform: PAM, PWM, PPM

unitOutcomes.description: Describe functions of each block of pulse code modulation (PCM) Transmitter and receiver
Explain delta modulation
Describe slop overload and granular noise
Explain adaptive Delta modulation technique
Explain working of Differential PCM (DPCM) transmitter and receiver
Compare the features of PCM, DM, ADM and DPCM
Explain 4 levels digital multiplexing Hierarchy
Describe TDM frame
Explain PCM-TDM system

topics.title: PCM transmitter and receiver
Advantage, disadvantage and application of PCM
Block diagram, waveforms, advantage of Delta Modulation
Disadvantage of DM (slop overload and Granular noise)
Adaptive Delta Modulation
Differential PCM
Comparison between PCM, DM, ADM and DPCM
Concept of Time division digital multiplexing, TDM frame
Block diagram of basic PCM-TDM system

unitOutcomes.description: Describe EM wave spectrum, Frequency ranges and its applications
Explain the basic concepts of Antenna
Types of antenna
Antennas for Special applications
Explain the concept of Smart Antenna and its applications
Explain different modes of wave propagations

topics.title: Electromagnetic (EM) wave spectrum, frequency bands and their applications domain
Definition: Antenna, Radiation of wave, radiation Pattern, isotopic Antenna, Polarization, Directivity and Gain
Dipole Antenna, Parabolic reflector antenna, Micro strip (patch) antenna
Base station antennas, Mobile station antennas
Smart Antenna need and applications
Space Wave propagation: Tropospherescattered propagation, Duct Propagation, Ground Wave propagation

studentActivities: Prepare specification of electronic components/ICs used in communication system
Give seminar on modulators, demodulators and communication techniques, types and applications
Prepare a PPT/animation of various pulse modulation techniques
Undertake a survey of different communication methods used in field
Prepare chart of radiation pattern of various antenna
Prepare the PPT/animations of 3-D radiation pattern and wave propagation of radio waves
instructionalStrategies: Massive open online courses (MOOCs) may be used to teach various topics/sub-topics
In Unit I various equation of AM, FM and PM can be explained without mathematical derivations
'L' in section No. 4 means different types of teaching methods that are to be employed by teachers to develop the outcomes
About 20% of the topics/sub-topics which are relatively simpler or descriptive in nature is to be given to the students for self-learning, but to be assessed using different assessment methods
With respect to section No.11, teachers need to ensure to create opportunities and provisions for co-curricular activities
Guide students on how to address issues on environment and sustainability
Guide students for using data manuals

microProjects.title: Build AM transmitter circuit using transistor/IC
Demonstrate AM communication System including AM transmitter and receiver
Build FM Transmitter circuit using IC
Demonstrate FM communication System including FM transmitter and receiver
Demonstrate Analog Communication system on Virtual Lab
Visit nearby FM radio station and prepare brief report including Gain, Frequency and Area specifications
Prepare Chart on Different Pulse Modulation techniques
Prepare Chart on Different line coding techniques
Prepare chart for recent trends of antenna applications i.e. PCB mounted miniature antennas, Automobile antennas, Car Keys antennas, Wi-Fi adaptor antennas, LORA antennas, IOT gateways antennas etc.

books.title: Communication Systems (Analog and Digital)
books.author: Sanjay Sharma
books.publication: S K Kataria and Sons, 4th Edition KATSON

books.title: Antenna and Wave propagation
books.author: Prasad, K.D. and Handa, Deepak
books.publication: Satya Prakashan, New Delhi, 3rd edition or latest

programOutcomes.description: Engineering Practices for Society, Sustainability & Environment
